description: Triangle of q-binomial coefficients for q=-5.
comments: May be read as a symmetric triangular (T[n,k]=T[n,n-k]; k=0,...,n; n=0,1,...) or square array (A[n,r]=A[r,n]=T[n+r,r], read by antidiagonals). The diagonals of the former (or rows/columns of the latter) are A000012 (k=0), A014986 (k=1), A015255 (k=2), A015272, A015291, A015309, A015327, A015344, A015360, A015377, A015391 (k=10), A015409, A015427,... - _M. F. Hasler_, Nov 04 2012
mathematica: Table[QBinomial[n, k, -5], {n, 0, 10}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 09 2016 *)
prog: (PARI) T015113(n, k, q=-5)=prod(i=1, k, (q^(1+n-i)-1)/(q^i-1)) \\ (Indexing is that of the triangular array: 0 <= k <= n = 0,1,2,...) - _M. F. Hasler_, Nov 04 2012
author: _Olivier Gérard_
